greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Exponential Riordan array (1,sin(x)).
comment: The row n=0 with T(0,0)=1 and the column T(n,0)=0, n>0, are not entered into the sequence here.
A signed version of A136630 (apart from row 0 and column 0). - Peter Bala, Oct 06 2011
Also the Bell transform of the sequence "a(n) = (-1)^(n/2) if n is even else 0" without column 0. For the definition of the Bell transform see A264428. - _Peter Luschny_, Jan 29 2016
link: G. C. Greubel, Table of n, a(n) for the first 50 rows, flattened
Vladimir Kruchinin, Composition of ordinary generating functions, arXiv:1009.2565, [math.CO], 2010.
maple: A185690 := proc(n,k) if type(k+n,'even') then 2^(1-k)/k! * add( (-1)^(floor((n+k)/2)-i)*binomial(k,i)*(2*i-k)^n,i=0..floor(k/2)) ; else 0; end if; end proc: # _R. J. Mathar_, Feb 21 2011
# The function BellMatrix is defined in A264428.
mathematica: t[n_, k_] /; OddQ[n - k] = 0; t[n_, k_] /; EvenQ[n - k] := 2^(1-k)/k!* Sum[ (-1)^(Floor[(n+k)/2] - i)*Binomial[k, i]*(2*i-k)^n, {i, 0, k/2}]; Table[t[n, k], {n, 1, 12}, {k, 1, n}] // Flatten (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Feb 21 2013 *)
BellMatrix[f_, len_] := With[{t = Array[f, len, 0]}, Table[BellY[n, k, t], {n, 0, len - 1}, {k, 0, len - 1}]];
Table[B[[n, k]], {n, 2, rows}, {k, 2, n}] // Flatten (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Jun 28 2018, after _Peter Luschny_ *)
program: from sympy import binomial, factorial as f, floor
def T(n, k): return 0 if (n - k)%2==1 else 2**(1 - k)/f(k)*sum([(-1)**(floor((n + k)/2) - i)*binomial(k, i)*(2*i - k)**n for i in range(0, floor(k/2) + 1)])
for n in range(1, 11): print [T(n, k) for k in range(1, n + 1)] # _Indranil Ghosh_, Jul 11 2017
results.author: _Vladimir Kruchinin_, Feb 10 2011
